Body: Description: on this webpage https://helpcenter.netwrix.com/bundle/EnterpriseAuditor_11.6/page/Content/EnterpriseAuditor/Admin/Settings/Connection/gMSA.htm It is stated "The account that Enterprise Auditor is run with must have permissions to retrieve the gMSA account password" Is this referencing the accounts running netwrix enterprise auditor web server? (aka services.msc) OR is this referencing members of the groups we've given admin access to (Settings>Access>member, member type, access type, role) because we're getting permissions denied with the GMSA account we created and are unsure which account may or may not need additional permissions. please define what "The account that Enterprise Auditor is run with" means and what setting would be the source of truth for this.

Hi @Dusty Grayson​ ,

 

Thank you for flagging this ticket. We have reviewed the Resolution Notes and may want it turned into a KB. However, we want to clarify some information first.

 

In the Resolution Notes, you mentioned: If scheduled tasks are running as System, then the computer object in AD needs the gMSA account password retrieval capability...Interactive users running the NEA console would also need gMSA account password retrieval capability. This is to manually kick off the job(s) from the right click menu option.

 

Would you please clarify if you are describing additional configuration or is it the same as what is described in the following documentation?

 

Schedule - Group Managed Service Accounts Configuration Section

 

CC: @Jake Mahon​ @Nicholas Zimmer​
